channel.title: QUEERY with Cameron Esposito
channel.description: Sit in on an hour long-conversation between host and standup comic, Cameron Esposito, and some of the brightest luminaries in the LGBTQ+ family. QUEERY explores individual stories of identity, personality and the shifting cultural matrix around gender, sexuality and civil rights.
channel.itunes:author: Earwolf
channel.itunes:summary: Sit in on an hour long-conversation between host and standup comic, Cameron Esposito, and some of the brightest luminaries in the LGBTQ+ family. QUEERY explores individual stories of identity, personality and the shifting cultural matrix around gender, sexuality and civil rights.

item.title: Dawn Laguens
item.description:
Planned Parenthood EVP Dawn Laguens sits down with Cameron to discuss the significance of Planned Parenthood, how knowing that your body is your own is the way to freedom, and being a service provider.
This episode is sponsored by TomboyX (www.tomboyx.com/QUEERYNEUTRAL code: QUEERYNEUTRAL), SugarBearHair (www.sugarbearhair.com/QUEERY), and HelloFresh (www.hellofresh.com/QUEERY30 code: QUEERY30).

item.title: Roxane Gay
item.description:
Writer Roxane Gay sits down with Cameron to discuss dating history, the pressure of representation, and the urgency to write about the current cultural moment.
This episode is sponsored by EverlyWell (www.everlywell.com code: QUEERY), TomboyX (www.tomboyx.com/QUEERYNEUTRAL code QUEERYNEUTRAL), and Casper Mattresses (www.casper.com/QUEERY code: QUEERY).

item.title: JFL NorthWest Live: Darcy Michael and Rhea Butcher
item.description:
Comedians Darcy Michael and Rhea Butcher sit down with Cameron live at JFL NorthWest to discuss their roles as standup comics, identifying as gender nonbinary, and being in a different place than your partner in a relationship.
This episode is sponsored by Tripping.com (www.tripping.com/QUEERY), TomboyX (www.tomboyx.com/QUEERY code: QUEERY), and Modclotch (www.modcloth.com code: QUEERY).

item.title: Kathy Tu
item.description:
Cameron sits down with podcaster Kathy Tu to discuss being "homoromantic," coming out to Mom, and the difficulties of straddling separate worlds and identities.
Don’t miss an episode! Subscribe @ smarturl.it/queery

item.content:encoded:
Cameron sits down with comedian Rhea Butcher to discuss being wives, growing up in Akron, and gender identity.
